seriesJson.title: Doctor tell me
seriesJson.description: Weekly interviews with a Minneapolis-St. Paul area doctor about a current medical issue. Interviews conducted by Audrey June Booth of KUOM (Radio station : Minneapolis, Minn.) .

node.title: Special diets for cancer
node.description: Program number 347 asks if special diets can be used to treat cancer.

node.title: Crash diets
node.description: Program number 340 asks if a crash diet is recommended for overweight people.

node.title: Remission
node.description: Program number 326 answers questions about remission.

node.title: Early symptoms of pregnancy
node.description: Program number 330 asks what can be done about the early symptoms of pregnancy.

node.title: Adverse reactions to medication
node.description: Program number 327 answers questions about people who react negatively to a medication.

node.title: Academic competition and suicide
node.description: Program number 344 asks what role high academic competition plays in suicide on campuses.

node.title: Maintaining weight loss
node.description: Program number 339 asks how to maintain weight loss.

node.title: New blood channels in the heart
node.description: Program number 335 asks how successful experiments have been to create new blood channels to the heart.

node.title: Are there patients who want to be sick?
node.description: Program number 349 asks about psychosomatic illnesses.

node.title: Is fatigue common during pregnancy?
node.description: Program number 331 asks if fatigue is common during pregnancy.

node.title: How easy is it to catch a cold?
node.description: Program number 329 asks if it is easy to catch a cold.

node.title: Function of the prostate gland
node.description: Program number 346 asks what is the function of the prostate gland.

node.title: Psychosomatic illnesses
node.description: Program number 353 focuses again on psychosomatic illnesses.

node.title: Potential suicide patients
node.description: Program number 342 asks how suicidal risk can be assessed.

node.title: Emergency room care
node.description: Program number 334 asks what emergency room care includes.

node.title: Fluid accumulation during pregnancy
node.description: Program number 351 asks how the abnormal accumulation of fluids in tissues can negatively impact pregnancies.

node.title: Why is suicide a paradox?
node.description: Program number 341 asks how suicide can be understood.

node.title: College students and suicide
node.description: Program number 343 asks why so many college students are committing suicide.

node.title: Leg cramps during pregnancy
node.description: Program number 350 asks why leg cramps occur during pregnancy.

node.title: Personal factors in suicide
node.description: Program number 345 asks how a feeling of self-punishment factors into suicide.

node.title: How do we hear?
node.description: Program number 337 asks what roles the different parts of the ear play in the hearing process.

node.title: Emergency health care training
node.description: Program number 333 asks how much training a person rendering emergency medical care should have.

node.title: Treating the common cold
node.description: Program number 328 talks about whether or not there has been any progress in treating the common cold.

node.title: When should a mole be removed?
node.description: Program number 348 asks when a mole should be removed.

node.title: Congenital heart defects
node.description: Program number 336 asks when most congenital heart defects are discovered.

node.title: Common cold
node.description: Program number 354 asks about progress on treatments for the common cold.

node.title: Most common forms of hearing loss
node.description: Program number 338 asks what are the most common forms of hearing loss.

node.title: Is fatigue common during pregnancy?
node.description: Program number 331 asks if fatigue is common during pregnancy.

node.title: Weight gain during pregnancy
node.description: Program number 332 asks how much weight a woman should gain during pregnancy.
